meanings.definition: Assist in bringing forth or bringing about
meanings.sent1: She midwifed the project to completion.
meanings.sent2: The midwife midwifed the baby's arrival smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The idea was midwifed into existence by her guidance.
meanings.sent5: His expertise midwifed the growth of the business.

meanings.sent1: They midwifed the new invention with care.
meanings.sent2: The midwife midwifed the birth of twins.
meanings.sent3: The team midwifed the launch of the product.
meanings.sent4: Her support midwifed the start of their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The doctor midwifed the arrival of the newborn.

meanings.sent1: She midwifed for many expecting mothers.
meanings.sent2: The midwife midwifed for the community for years.
meanings.sent3: He midwifed with skill and compassion.
meanings.sent4: Their friend midwifed for the first time.
meanings.sent5: The experienced midwife midwifed with expertise.
